subject: Home & DIY
title: The Dual-Flush Toilet's Australian Origin
description: A fast breakdown of The Dual-Flush Toilet's Australian Origin for builders.

hook.text: Australia invented the dual-flush toilet in 1980 because the continent can't afford to waste six gallons per flush.

buildup.text: Bruce Thompson of Caroma designed two buttons: a half flush (3L) for liquids and a full flush (6L) for solids.

discovery.text: The design cuts water per flush by 32%. Across millions of toilets, that's billions of liters saved each year.

twist.text: Australia mandated dual-flush in all new construction by 1993. Most of the world still hasn't caught up 30 years later.

climax.text: Water scarcity drove innovation. Australia's codes are now the global gold standard for water-efficient plumbing.

punchline.text: Drought made Australia flush smarter than everyone.

quiz.question: What motivated Australia to invent the dual-flush toilet?
options: Water scarcity across the continent made conservation essential
A government competition offered a prize for water innovation
European toilet designs didn't work with Australian plumbing
